MOBILE APPLICATION SECURITY
Enable and Configure Mobile App Security Policies

Use the convenient Setup UI to enable, configure, and enforce mobile security policies.

REQUIRED USER PERMISSIONS
USER PERMISSIONS NEEDED
To create and modify Enhanced Mobile App Security settings:	

Manage Enhanced Mobile App Security

AND

Modify Metadata

NOTE If you already have mobile security policies configured via connected app attributes, you can migrate your existing security policies to the Setup UI.

To configure your policies:

From Setup, in the Quick Find box, enter Mobile Security, and then select Mobile Security.
Select the iOS or Android tab.

Each severity level represents the actions enforced in the event of a violation.

SEVERITY LEVEL	ACTIONS ENFORCED
critical	Wipes app data and logs user out
error	Blocks access to the app until the issue is resolved, but doesn’t log user out
warn	Notifies the user of the violation and recommends how to resolve, but user is able to continue using the app
info	Blocks prohibited action or logs user action and informs user

At cold starts and when a user’s access token has expired, Enhanced Mobile App Security checks policies and enforces actions. Users can also manually recheck their policies.

TIP

Mobile security policies take effect when users force quit the Salesforce mobile app or when they log in to a new session. To ensure that new or modified settings take effect for all users, we recommend that you revoke access to the Salesforce mobile app so everyone is required to log in again.

We also recommend that you warn users about the changes that you intend to make, especially if you restrict previously available activities.

POLICY NAME	DESCRIPTION	SEVERITY LEVEL
Authentication Server Certificate Pinning	

Certificate pinning for the authentication server URLs where the user provides credentials to log in.

For more info, see Configure Authentication Server Certificate Pin.

	

Severity: info


Resource Certificate Pinning	Certificate pinning for the resource URLs used by the app to fetch data for the user.	Severity: info
Block Jailbroken Device	A jailbroken or rooted mobile device can access system files to install unapproved apps or to modify settings.	

Severity:

critical
error
warn

Block Man In The Middle Attack	A man-in-the-middle attack allows attackers to secretly intercept communications between two systems, client and server.	

Severity:

critical
error
warn

Malware Detection (Android Only)	Malware is malicious software designed to harm or gain access to a device. Specify if you want to enable malware detection.	

Severity:

critical
error
warn

Minimum OS Version	Specify the minimum operating system (OS) version your user’s mobile device must meet.	

The number of the minimum OS version.

Severity:

critical
error
warn

Example: 11.9


Maximum OS Version	Specify the maximum operating system (OS) version your user's mobile device can’t exceed.	

Severity:

critical
error
warn

Example: 12.1.9


Minimum Security Patch Version (Android only)	A security patch helps protect a user’s mobile device from vulnerabilities. Specify the required minimum security patch version.	

The date of the minimum security patch version.

Severity:

critical
error
warn

Example: 2027-05-18


Minimum Application Version	Specify the minimum app version that must be installed on your user’s mobile device.	

Severity:

critical
error
warn

Example: 1.0


Maximum Application Version	Specify the maximum app version that can be installed on your user’s mobile device.	

Severity:

critical
error
warn

Example: 220.6


Require Device Passcode	A device passcode adds a layer of security for your user’s mobile device. Specify if you want to require a device passcode. The Require Device Passcode and Check Biometric Login Data policies can’t be enabled at the same time.	

Severity:

critical
error
warn

Check Biometric Login Data	Validate biometric login data every time a user opens the app. The Check Biometric Login Data and Require Device Passcode policies can’t be enabled at the same time.	

Severity:

critical
error
warn

Log Out User After Changing Biometric Login Data	Biometric login uses facial or fingerprint recognition to unlock devices and apps.	

Severity: info


Log Out User After Device Restart	Specify if you want to log out a user after a device restart.	

Severity: info


Blocked Device List	A device blocklist is a list of devices that a user is blocked from using. Specify blocked devices as a semicolon separated list.	

Severity:

critical
error
warn

Examples:

iPhone11,8 (blocks iPhone XR)
Google (blocks all Google devices)

Allowed Device List	A device allowlist is a list of devices that a user can use. Specify allowed devices as a semicolon separated list.	

Severity:

critical
error
warn

Examples:

iPhone11,8 (allows iPhone XR)

Block OS Share Actions (iOS only)	A user can perform specific tasks such as copying a link or saving an image with operating system (OS) share actions.	

Severity: info


Block 3D Touch (iOS only)	3D touch or long press is when a user presses and holds an app icon to perform tasks without having to open the app first.	

Severity: info


Block Microphone (iOS only)	Block microphone access on a user’s device.	

Severity: info


Block Camera (iOS only)	Block camera access on a user’s device.	

Severity: info


Block Screenshot (Android only)	A screenshot captures what’s displayed on a user’s mobile device. Specify if you want to block screenshots.	

Severity: info


Block Contacts	Block access to contacts on a user's device.	

Severity: info


Block Calendar	Block calendar access on a user’s device.	

Severity: info


Disable URL Caching (iOS only)	URL cache saves some information from visited websites. Specify if you want to disable URL caching.	

Severity: info


Maximum Days Offline Without Policy Refresh	We perform a security policy refresh when a user opens the app. Specify the maximum number of days a user can go without a security policy refresh.	

Severity:

critical
error
warn

Example: 30


Block File Backups (iOS only)	

A file backup, such as iCloud, syncs files and photos from a user’s mobile device onto cloud storage.

The policy blocks files saved within the Salesforce mobile app from syncing to a file backup.

	

Severity: info


Mobile Browser URI Scheme	Specify the mobile browser URI scheme for opening links on a user’s device.	

Severity: info

Example for Chrome on iOS: googlechromes://


Phone Call Application Handler	Specify an app to use for making a phone call on a user’s device.	

Severity: info

The value must be configured as a https:// link to the phone call app. The app is also required to Universal Links (iOS) and AsssetLinks (Android).


Log Security Policy Evaluation Result	A security policy evaluation assesses whether users are meeting security requirements. Log the results of a security policy evaluation.	

Severity: info


Log Screenshot (iOS only)	

A screenshot captures what’s displayed on a user’s mobile device. An event is logged when a user takes a screenshot.

The event is sent to the org’s event stream and can be viewed any even streaming integration, such as Splunk or Fairwarning.

The event doesn’t log the screenshot image itself. It only logs the event of a user taking a screenshot.

	

Severity: info


Log Email	Log the event when a user emails a contact from the app.	

Severity: info


Log Phone Call	Log the event when a user makes a phone call from the app.	

Severity: info


Log SMS	Log the event when a user sends a text message from the app.	

Severity: info

TIP Use the Security Center app to define and deploy mobile app security policies to selected tenants from the Mobile App Security Policy option in Security Center. For more information on using Security Center to deploy security policies, see Define and Deploy Security Policies.
